title: WW Rework Incoming?
body:

replies.body:
Now let's all calm down here. 

To set expectations:

Some of the members of the Taric group have begun early development on a new project. While it's too early to talk about what that project is, what I can say is that it is Certainly noT Warwick.

>
> CertainlyT Warwick

Turning the simplest jungler kit in the game into one of the most complicated
THAT won't alienate any of the current Warwick players.
See, the problem being there have to be current Warwick players to disappoint

You know, the same could have been said about Mordekaiser back in the day.
And we all know how that turned out.

> [{quoted}](name=Tahm the Catfish,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dE1Qls8A,comment-id=000b00010000,timestamp=2016-03-10T18:58:13.888+0000)
>
> See, the problem being there have to be current Warwick players to disappoint

He's definitely below average in popularity, but a popularity rate of 4% could definitely be a lot worse.
{{champion:30}}: If only I had as much players as Warwick... *tear*

{{champion:43}} Remember that rework I got to make me popular?
. . . I didn't work.
Give the man some credit, he handled {{champion:51}} 's update. As long as he's not creating a *new* champion it's OK.
He ALSO did {{champion:104}}' rework.

> [{quoted}](name=charcharmunro,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dE1Qls8A,comment-id=000b000100020000,timestamp=2016-03-10T19:59:55.410+0000)
>
> He ALSO did {{champion:104}}' rework.

Graves Rework was awesome, one of the best reworks so far!

Mordekaiser on the other hand ...
It's also rather horrendously overtuned and overly capable. Not, like, STUPID good anymore, but he's definitely a bit overbearing.
It's not overloaded, it's built to do a thing, and it does it insanely well. Is it OP, yes. Is it broken, No.
Overtuned isn't overloaded. Overtuned just means the numbers are too high.
Four seperate 3-hit passive minigames.
He's not Gypsylord though.
Why the F*** you lyyyyin, why you always lyyyyyyin mmmmmmm omygod
Wut? It wasn't Warwick it was Ryze. Warwick started after Ryze
Holy thread necro Reav3, so are you guys happy with new WW so far. Do you think hes a good representation of the Diver class now

Well that response showed up in my inbox just now so I responded ;)

So far we are and think that both him and Camille are unique takes on what we want from divers. He's not even live yet though so we will see.
About Galio, do you think he'll get his VGU released before the halfway point of 2017? And has the next champion been chosen for a VGU already?

I should have a blog out in a few weeks that goes over the next 2 VGUs after Galio as well as the next class update. 

If all things go smoothly Galio should be out before the next new Champion and definitely before the Mid Season class update.

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dE1Qls8A,comment-id=000b001900000000000000010000,timestamp=2017-01-16T19:28:03.574+0000)
>
> I should have a blog out in a few weeks that goes over the next 2 VGUs after Galio as well as the next class update. 
> 
> **If all things go smoothly Galio should be out before the next new Champion** and definitely before the Mid Season class update.

**SMOOTHLY?!**

What kind of speed are you people working at?  Galio was announced a while after Warwick's!  And now you're saying Galio's rework might be the next release?!

What are you guys doing to yourselves?  Injecting Redbull into your veins and snorting duracle batteries?!
There are 2 separate VGU teams. The team working on Galio stated on it right after they finished Yorick
Hmmm I have replied to many Mordekaiser posts about him being a high priority for a full VGU in the future

Honestly with the current speed of the VGU-teams I'd say that it is actually likely for Morde to get his VGU in 2018.

I mean there were ~6 months between the ryze update and the upcoming WW-rework and it was said that Galio will likely arrive before the next new champion,meaning that Galio will likely come out during febuary in which case his rework will come out ~5 months after the Yorick update.
So it is likely that we'll get at least 2 other VGUs this year,maybe even 3 if we are lucky(or 4 if we are REALLY lucky,but that seems really unlikely) and then again 4-6 VGUs next year.
Meaning we'll get ~7 more VGUs in this year and the next one.
And Mordekaiser actually ranks within the top 7 rework-candidates(I think there were only 6 other champs who were known to be a high priority,namely {{champion:6}} {{champion:28}} {{champion:20}}  {{champion:50}} {{champion:39}} and {{champion:80}} )
I love you Ralanr. Never stop being you

> [{quoted}](name=Mounted Kled,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dE1Qls8A,comment-id=000b001900000000000000010000000b0002,timestamp=2017-01-16T21:50:34.263+0000)
>
> I love you Ralanr. Never stop being you

And I love you, random citizen who apparently knows me better than I know myself.

_Injecting Redbull into your veins and snorting duracle batteries?!_

That is the funniest shit I have hear in a long time.

So basically Galio needed less work and instead of announcing who'll be next (like with Galio when Yorick was released), you will simultaneously announce who WW and Galio team will newly be working on? This sounds as If one of the reworks was easier to do. Since Warwick is gameplay-wise more of modernization than rework, does this mean it's possible one of next VGUs will also be directed to keep more of core mechanics and focus on modernisation?

It doesn't mean any of that. We have 2 separate VGU teams. The one that just finished Warwick started on WW right after they finished Ryze and the team working Im Galio started after they finished Yorick

Yeah I was talking about you saying:

> I should have a blog out in a few weeks that goes over the next 2 VGUs

Now reading it second time I got it that you will be probably iterating and explaining what you have so far with Galio and announce next one. For some reason it sounded to me that you would announce two new VGUs at that blog. my bad :x

I am going to announce the next 2 VGUs after Galio in the blog. At least which champions they are. You should look for my blog on the champion update process. We usually have 2 very small teams doing early exploration into our next projects 3-4 months before we go into full production and announce it.

Basically as soon as Galio and WW went into production we began to explore a bunch of different ideas and designs for champions that could be next after Galio and WW. We have got to the point we're we feel confident in what the next 2 VGUs will be and are almost ready to talk about it. :)

Is there a reason that you guys are going to continue doing "class updates" rather than releasing reworks/tweaks at a steady pace? from what i can tell the class updates have been mostly misses IMO because it's way to many changes at one time. It seems like problem champs like {{champion:96}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:72}}{{champion:134}} (and more) end up in bad states because of poor reworks, but it takes an incredible amount of time before they get any follow up. Also, one of the biggest problems is that mains of these champs feel all but completely neglected since their feedback is lost in the sea of complaints about all the other champs. It seems as though once riot releases the "class update" they just stop trying because it's simply TOO MUCH to deal with.

It's because we can pair the kit changes with item and system changes as well. We can also give a whole class clearer strengths/weaknesses that make more sense in relation to each other when they are all updated at once. 

While we have definitely had some hit/misses on a per champion basis we feel the entire class is in a way better spot after the class update so they are very worth doing. Also even for the ones that miss they are usually in a healthier spot then before the rework (Kog being the exception)
Oh yeah one more thing, I've been eternally curious as how to pronounce your name, is it r- eve or do you actually count the 3
R-eve like Reaver but shortened
When can we expect an updated "Update Schedule" for the site?
Right after the blog goes live
That means Swain could make it this year?
When you guys get to Divers for a class update, will you model the class after them

It wouldn't be modeling the divers after them. They are modeled after our internal definition of divers. The diver class update would just bring the rest of the classes into line with them.

As seen in Statikks class blog awhile back we already have models for all the sub classes we just haven't updated all the classs to match them yet.

About Statikks class blog,

I'm a huge fan of the new nomenclature. I'm a bit disapointed that Riot hasn't started using it all the time, however. 

For instance, according to the client, the different classes are Tank, Fighter, Assassin, Mage, Marksman, and Support. (I'm talking about the frequency bar graph that shows up when you view match history). Why aren't you using the new terminology?
I agree and it's something we have been talking about recently as well.
So when will the new terminology from the class blog be implemented? It's almost been a year since Stattik discussed about the new champion classification.

Just curious with Camille and Warwick. Was it intentional to do 2 champions from Piltover/Zaun? did you guys talk with the Camille team a lot? I cant help but feel like you guys at least realized you'd have this lineup and intentionally made the 2 mirror each other in a lot of ways.

Like both are vigilante types. Both struggle with their identities after being changed. But Camille chose it and has very upper class and kind of villainous motivations but is still kind of relatable. while Warwick is almost the exact opposite, was forced to change, wants to protect the victims of those in power, but hes also more of a beast etc

Or am I reading into it too much and things just worked out that way


PS: I know its not really your area but Piltover/Zaun ama whennnnnn

It wasn't intentional in the beginning, no. Once Camille was further along and it was decided she was from Piltover and coming out close to Warwick we did talk a lot with the Camille team though and also with foundations. This led to us putting it all together into a big cool Zaun/Piltover event!
that means Taric is done too!

Not necessarily.

It means that the people that are on the earlier stages of development (Design/concept art/narrative/character art) are less busy on Taric, and so have a bit of bandwidth to explore a new project. Rioters at the end of production FX/Anim/Audio/VO are still hard at work finishing Taric!
